channel.title: artificial intelligence on Miranda Zhang's Website
channel.description: Recent content in artificial intelligence on Miranda Zhang's Website

item.title: Feeling surprisingly energized by AI discussion, but mainly when (a) I'm successfully learning (so this is not a signal about the domain), (b) evaluating AI safety stories (maybe a sign I should trial strategy fit?), (c) talking to my friends (I am extremely suspicious of this convergence and would bet on this leading me to overestimate the impact of these discussions)
item.description:
Feeling surprisingly energized by AI discussion, but

  • mainly when I’m successfully learning (so this is not a signal about the domain)
  • when evaluating AI safety stories (maybe a sign I should trial strategy fit?)
  • when talking to my friends (I am extremely suspicious of this convergence and would bet on this leading me to overestimate the impact of these discussions)

item.title: pivoted from testing technical research fit to reading about s-risks and I'm pleasantly surprised by the fact that, for the first time in a bit, I'm actually keen to spend my day ~ working ~ (e.g., I'm bothered by distractions and want to turn my notifications off)
item.description:
pivoted from testing technical research fit to reading about s-risks and I’m pleasantly surprised by the fact that, for the first time in a bit, I’m actually keen to spend my day ~ working ~ (e.g., I’m bothered by distractions and want to turn my notifications off)

(definitely still testing fit - have scheduled something for next sunday, and might still do some AIS stuff today!)

item.title: Want to test your fit for AI technical safety research with me?
item.description:
I’m open to a variety of options, whether a couple hours over several days or a weekend ‘retreat!’ (I’m kind of psyched about the retreat option, which is probably just crashing a group house)

I keep saying that ‘I should (and will) test my fit for AI technical research,’ but actually doing this seems increasingly aversive. So, here’s an open call to my non-technical (and technical, if you enjoy watching your friend(s) struggle) friends to spend a day testing our fits for AISTR!

I was thinking we could try finding solutions for ELK or follow Holden Karnofsky’s advice in this post: https://forum.effectivealtruism.org/.../important…

(context: me having blocked out the entire day to do this, and feeling worried I’m going to give up halfway through)
